Chakshurunmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha

In this session we will be discussing from two verses
The sixth verse
And the seventh verses
Of the eleventh chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
These two verses are given separately
But they are related
So I will discuss in this one session
Both the verses
First I will discuss the sixth verse
Natas Mate Natas Sadangri Pankajam
Virincha Vairincha Surendra Vanditam
Parayanam Chemam Ihe Chathamparam
Nayatrakala Prabhavet Paraprabhu
This is one of the prayers offered by the citizens of Dwaraka to Krishna
The citizens said
O Lord you are worshipped by all demigods like Brahma
The four Sanas
Sanaka, Sanatana, Sanandana and Sanatkumara
And even the king of heaven
Surendra
The king of heaven Indra
You are the ultimate rest for those who are really aspiring to achieve the highest benefit of life
You are the supreme transcendental lord
And inevitable time cannot exert its influence upon you
So these citizens are enlightened persons
They know what is Krishna's position
There
Attachment or attraction for Krishna is not blind
They are not ignorant fools
They are completely knowledge
So one of the important points to remember is
Bhakti means knowledge
Bhakti means complete material detachment
Bhakti means pure heart
That is Bhakti
Bhakti is not just a word of speech
Bhakti is not just a word of speech
Bhakti is not just a word of speech
Bhakti is not just another material sentiment
In a heart filled with material desires
In a heart full of ignorance
That is not Bhakti
That may appear like Bhakti
Or that may be a beginning of one's expression of devotion to Krishna
But one has to make progress
From the stage of sentiment
To the stage of
Actual devotion
Filled with knowledge
Detachment
Transcendental feelings
Etc.
So
Prabhupada explains in the purport
The supreme lord is Shri Krishna
Is confirmed in Bhagavad Gita
Brahma Samhita
And other authorized Vedic literatures
No one is equal to him
And no one is greater than him
And that is a verdict of all this knowledge
All the scriptures
He is the supreme
The supreme means nobody is equal to him
And nobody is greater than him
There is no competition
Between Krishna and the other Devata's
Between Devata's there is competition
Though there is hierarchy among Devata's
Though there is hierarchy among Devata's
But still their position is never permanent
The Devata's position is not permanent
The entire temple repose
The entire temple repose
The entire temple repose
The entire temple repose
creation will be destroyed completely along with the demigods quitting their posts that
their body itself will be finished so what to speak of their post but Krishna's position as
the supreme Lord is not a position exactly it is he who is always the supreme he is not occupying
the post as if the post is sometimes vacant and somebody else may come no he is the supreme Lord
constitutionally the influence of time and space is exerted upon the dependent living entities we
are all dependent in this material world those are taken birth by force of karma we depend on
the material nature and there is Kala
powerful Kala which restricts our duration of life in this body which limits everything what
we can do now we as living beings we are part and parcel of Krishna but what is our position
the living entities are predominated Brahman we are spirit we are spiritual beings and
Lord is spirit, supreme spirit, supremely spiritual being. But we are predominated, we are controlled, we are subordinate to Krishna.
Whereas the supreme Lord is a predominating absolute. He is always the Lord, the controller, the master, the enjoyer, the supremely powerful. That we have to remember.
As soon as we forget this clear fact, we are at once in illusion. There are only two states of existence for every living being.
Either we are in Krishna.

Krishna consciousness, where we are properly situated under the full protection of Krishna, Krishna providing us with everything without even ever asking, or we are in the shelter of the illusory energy and the illusory energy is very stringent laws which are governing every single being.
We are in illusion because we forget who we are, we forget who is Krishna, we forget our spiritual nature. We think we are product of matter. We identify with the body. This is illusion.
And threefold miseries constantly occur.
We are constantly attacking the body, the mind.
The clear consciousness of the cognizant living being is God consciousness.
Cognizant means we are always full of consciousness, aware, we are always aware.
That awareness is distinctly a quality of the living being as opposed to the body.
Matter. Matter doesn't have cognizant, doesn't have awareness, doesn't have consciousness.
So we are not matter. We are not this material body. We are not product of material nature. No.
In God consciousness or Krishna consciousness, one bows down unto Him. Him means Krishna, the Supreme Lord, in all circumstances.
Eternally we are subordinate. Eternally we should be grateful to Krishna for everything.
The seventh verse.
tvameva mātā atha suhṛt patih pitā tvam sad-gurur naḥ paramam ca daivatam yasyān vṛtyākṛtino bhavu vimā
The meaning of this seventh verse is
O creator of the universe, you are our mother, well-wisher, lord, father, spiritual master and worshipable deity.
Krishna is everything for his devotees.
So that is being highlighted here.
By following in your footsteps, we have become successful in every respect.
We pray therefore that you continue to bless us with your mercy.
So Sri Lapa Rāpāda explains in the purport.
The all-good personality of Godhead, being the creator of the universe, also plans for the good of all good living beings.
See actually Krishna does not make a distinction between different living beings in this world as good and bad.
But we become good or bad according to our good and bad.
According to our attitude, according to our choice, the choice we make.
So he has all good plans for us, Krishna.
The good living beings are advised by the Lord to follow his good advice.
And by doing so, they become successful in all spheres of life.
Success in life, especially in human life, is not just about success.
When we follow Krishna's instructions, as he has given us advice in the Bhagavad Gita.
There is no need to worship any deity but the Lord.
This material world is such a complex place.
People have so many material desires.
And they sometimes think that
the devatas can fulfill my material desires better than Krishna.
Or they are ignorant of Krishna.
So therefore they don't even approach Krishna.
They only go to demigods.
Or some of them who are completely atheistic.
They don't even go to any demigods or Krishna.
They simply depend upon their own personal strength, personal abilities, personal intelligence.
Without realizing all these personal things are given by Krishna only through material nature.
So foolish people are like that.
So Prabhupada says there is no need to worship any deity other than Krishna.
Krishna is the only worshipable Lord for everyone.
Even the devatas worship Krishna as was explained in the previous verse.
Brahma, Shiva, Indra, the topmost devatas.
Everyone, all the devatas are Vishnu Bhakta.
Vishnu Bhakta Smruto Daiva Asuras Tad Viparyaya.
Asuras are non-devotees.
All the 33 crore devatas in this one universe are all devotees of Vishnu or Krishna.
So if they are worshipping Krishna, why shouldn't we worship Krishna?
They derive everything they have including their power from Krishna.
So we should understand Krishna's position is absolute Lord.
Not relatively situated as Lord sometimes. No.
The demigods are relatively situated.
The Lord is all-powerful and if he is satisfied by our obedience unto his Lord's feet,
he is competent to bestow upon us all kinds of blessings
for the successful execution of both our material and spiritual lives.
This is an important point Srila Prabhupada is making.
For spiritual life, somebody may think I may have to worship Krishna.
But for material life, they think they have to worship some devatas
or they have to work hard in material existence.
No. There is no need of any separate endeavor for success in material life either.
Both materially and spiritually we are successful simply by worshipping Krishna,
by depending on Krishna, by following Krishna's instructions even in material life.
And it is important to remember for attaining spiritual existence,
the human form is a chance for all of us to understand our eternal relation with God.
We have an eternal relationship with Krishna.
It is not like the material relationships which are based on this body.
They end with the body. Material relationships end with the body.
Spiritual relationship is with Krishna.
And that is eternal. That is never based on this body.
It is actually the relationship between the soul and this Supreme Lord Krishna.
It is eternal to Supreme Soul. That relationship.
Because soul is eternal. Krishna is eternal.
Therefore relationship is also eternal. Soul to soul.
Our relation with Him is eternal. It can either be broken or vanquished.
Material relationships are broken.
Spiritual relationship with Krishna is never broken.
It is just forgotten for the time being.
Now somebody may be forgetful of Krishna.
But it can be revived also by the grace of the Lord if we follow His injunctions.
If we follow His instructions, it can be revived.
And these injunctions are revealed in the scriptures of all times and all places.
Shastra means that which gives us the instructions.
How we can revive our memory of Krishna.
That is what is actually explained in the Shastra.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
